intro: Ornithogalum malatyanum subsp. aricakense, commonly known as the Aricak bulbous plant, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers during the spring or early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or semi-arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in its native region.
